title: Create boilerplate code for flutter app
description:
Title: Set Up Flutter Project with Navigation

Description:
As a developer, I want to create a Flutter project with a structured boilerplate, including a bottom navigation bar, so that the app is clean, modular, and ready for future features.

Point Value: 3

Acceptance Criteria:
- The app launches with a blank screen.
- A bottom navigation bar is present but empty.
- The project follows Flutter best practices for structuring widgets and navigation.
- The code is clean, modular, and follows state management best practices.

Definition of Done (DoD):
- Code is committed and pushed to the repository.
- The app runs successfully on an emulator/device without errors.
- Navigation structure is set up, even if tabs are empty.
- The project is structured for scalability and maintainability.

Non-Functional Requirements:
- Performance: The app should launch within 2 seconds.
- Code Quality: Code must follow Flutterâ€™s best practices and be properly documented.
- Scalability: The structure should support adding new features without major refactoring.

notes.note: marked this issue as related to #1

title: Create Qibla Finder menu tab and page
description:
Title: Implement Qibla Finder Tab and Navigation

Description:
As a user, I want to access the Qibla Finder from the bottom navigation bar so that I can quickly navigate to the page when needed.

Point Value: 2

Acceptance Criteria:
- A new button labeled "Qibla Finder" is added to the bottom navigation bar.
- Tapping the button navigates to a new page.
- The new page has a title "Qibla Finder" at the top.
- The page is currently blank, leaving space for future features.

Definition of Done (DoD):
- The Qibla Finder button is visible on the navigation bar.
- Clicking the button opens the Qibla Finder page.
- The page displays a title at the top.
- No functional features yet; just UI and navigation setup.
- Code is committed and pushed to the repository.

Non-Functional Requirements:
- Performance: Navigation between tabs should be smooth and load within 1 second.
- User Experience: The tab label and page title should be clearly visible.

title: Create Calendar menu tab and page
description:
Title: Implement Islamic Calendar Tab and Navigation

Description:
As a user, I want to access the Islamic Calendar from the bottom navigation bar so that I can stay informed about important religious dates.

Point Value: 2

Acceptance Criteria:
- A new button labeled "Calendar" is added to the bottom navigation bar.
- Tapping the button navigates to a new page.
- The new page has a title "Calendar" at the top.
- The page is currently blank, leaving space for future features.

Definition of Done (DoD):
- The Calendar button is visible on the navigation bar.
- Clicking the button opens the Calendar page.
- The page displays a title at the top.
- No functional features yet; just UI and navigation setup.
- Code is committed and pushed to the repository.

Non-Functional Requirements:
- Performance: Navigation between tabs should be smooth and load within 1 second.
- User Experience: The tab label and page title should be clearly visible.

title: Create Prayer Times menu tab and page
description:
Title: Implement Prayer Times Tab and Navigation

Description:
As a user, I want to access the Prayer Times from the bottom navigation bar so that I can check the daily prayer schedule easily.

Point Value: 2

Acceptance Criteria:
- A new button labeled "Prayer Times" is added to the bottom navigation bar.
- Tapping the button navigates to a new page.
- The new page has a title "Prayer Times" at the top.
- The page is currently blank, leaving space for future features.

Definition of Done (DoD):
- The Prayer Times button is visible on the navigation bar.
- Clicking the button opens the Prayer Times page.
- The page displays a title at the top.
- No functional features yet; just UI and navigation setup.
- Code is committed and pushed to the repository.

Non-Functional Requirements:
- Performance: Navigation between tabs should be smooth and load within 1 second.
- User Experience: The tab label and page title should be clearly visible.

description:

- A new Flutter project is created using flutter create my_app

title: Project restructure to follow MVVM
description:
We found that it would be worthwhile to convert our project into an MVVM structure in order to ensure better readability and maintainability for future implementations.
Acceptance Criteria:
- Separate layers into seperate directories/files.
- Ensure ViewModels handle logic and state management.
- Views only handle UI rendering and user interactions.
- Models handle data representation and API interactions (if any).
- Update any necessary navigation and data flow to respect MVVM.
- Refactor existing features to conform to the MVVM pattern without breaking existing functionality.

title: Retrieve User Location
description:
Title: Display Userâ€™s Current Location

Description:
As a user, I want the app to detect and display my current location, so that the Qibla Finder can provide accurate prayer directions based on my position.

Point Value: 3

Acceptance Criteria:
- The app requests location access upon first launch.
- The userâ€™s current coordinates (latitude & longitude) are displayed on the Qibla Finder page.
- If location access is denied, a manual input option is provided.

Definition of Done (DoD):
- The app successfully detects and displays real-time location data.
- Location retrieval works across different regions and devices.
- The feature is tested to handle location errors gracefully (e.g., no GPS signal, permission denied).
- Code is committed and pushed to the repository.

Non-Functional Requirements:
- Performance: Location retrieval should complete within 2 seconds.
- Privacy: User location data should not be stored or shared without consent.

title: Implement Compass UI
description:
Title: Display a Compass on the Qibla Finder Page

Description:
As a user, I want to see a compass that updates based on my orientation, so that I can align myself properly before locating the Qibla.

Point Value: 3

Acceptance Criteria:
- A compass UI is displayed on the Qibla Finder page.
- The compass updates dynamically as the user moves their device.
- The user's current location is displayed at the top for reference.

Definition of Done (DoD):
- The compass needle responds to device movement without delays.
- The UI is clear and user-friendly, ensuring ease of navigation.
- The compass remains accurate and stable across multiple test cases.
- Code is committed and pushed to the repository.

Non-Functional Requirements:
- Performance: Compass updates should occur with minimal lag.
- User Experience: The compass UI should be responsive and intuitive.

title: Display Qibla Direction & Visual Indicator
description:
Title: Qibla Finder with Directional Feedback

Description:
As a user, I want the Qibla Finder to indicate when I am correctly facing the Qibla, so that I know exactly when I am aligned for prayer.

Point Value: 5

Acceptance Criteria:
- The Qibla direction is calculated based on the userâ€™s location and displayed on the compass.
- A visual indicator (e.g., glowing green highlight) appears when the user is correctly facing the Qibla.
- If the user is not aligned, the UI subtly guides them to adjust their position.

Definition of Done (DoD):
- The Qibla direction updates dynamically as the user rotates their device.
- The indicator turns green when the user is facing the correct direction.
- The experience is tested across different locations to ensure accuracy.
- Code is committed and pushed to the repository.

Non-Functional Requirements:
- Accuracy: The Qibla direction must have a maximum deviation of Â±1Â°.
- User Experience: The transition between incorrect and correct alignment should be smooth and non-disruptive.

description:
As a
Muslim user

I want to
Use the app to find the Qibla direction based on my current location

So that I can
Always pray in the correct direction, no matter where I am

Acceptance Criteria:
- The app accesses my GPS location
- A compass or AR-based Qibla direction is displayed
- The direction updates dynamically as I move

title: Islamic Calendar Integration
description:
As a user, I want the app to integrate the Islamic (Hijri) calendar alongside the Gregorian calendar so that I can easily view and manage dates according to Islamic events and timelines.

Acceptance Criteria:
- The app displays the Islamic date corresponding to the current Gregorian date.
- Users can toggle between Gregorian and Islamic views.
- Islamic holidays (e.g., Ramadan, Eid) are highlighted.
- Date calculations respect local moon sighting rules where possible.

title: User Interface of Islamic Calendar
description:
As a user, I want the Islamic calendar to have a clear and user-friendly interface, so that navigating dates and understanding Islamic events is simple and intuitive.

Acceptance Criteria:
- The Islamic calendar has a clean, mobile-responsive layout.
- Users can swipe or tap to navigate months.
- Important Islamic dates are visually distinguished (e.g., special color or badge).
- The UI supports RTL (Right-to-Left) languages like Arabic.

title: View Islamic Calendar
description:
As a
Muslim user

I want to
View an Islamic calendar that updates dynamically with the lunar cycle

So that I can
Plan my worship and observe important Islamic dates like Ramadan and Eid

Acceptance Criteria:
- The app fetches real-time lunar calendar data via an API
- The calendar highlights major Islamic events and holidays
- Users can toggle between Hijri and Gregorian calendar views

title: Prayer Times UI
description:
As a Muslim user, I want to see a clear and accessible UI for daily prayer times based on my location, so that I can quickly check when each prayer occurs.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Prayer times are displayed prominently and cleanly for the current day.
- Each prayer (Fajr, Dhuhr, Asr, Maghrib, Isha) is clearly labeled with its corresponding time.
- The UI updates automatically based on location.
- Next upcoming prayer is visually highlighted.
- The UI supports both light and dark modes.

title: Fetching Prayer Times from Aladhan API
description:
As a Muslim user, I want the app to fetch accurate prayer times from the Aladhan API based on my detected or selected location, so that I can rely on the appâ€™s timings.

Acceptance Criteria:
- The app sends a request to the Aladhan API using the user's current location coordinates.
- The app correctly parses the API response and maps prayer times to the UI.
- The system handles errors gracefully (e.g., API downtime, no network).
- Prayer times are refreshed daily and when location changes.

title: Set Up Prayer Reminders
description:
As a
Muslim user

I want to
Receive automatic reminders for my daily prayers based on my location

So that I can
Stay consistent with my prayers, even in a non-Muslim environment

Acceptance Criteria:
- The app detects my location and sets accurate prayer times accordingly
- I can customize the notification settings (enable/disable, sound, vibration)
- I receive a timely reminder before each prayer

title: Prayer Time Notifications
description:
As a Muslim user, I want to receive timely and customizable notifications for each prayer time, so that I stay consistent with my prayers even in a non-Muslim environment.

Acceptance Criteria:
- Notifications are triggered a few minutes before each prayer time.
- Users can enable/disable notifications per prayer.
- Users can choose notification style (silent, vibration, sound).
- Notifications adjust automatically based on any location or prayer time update.

title: Implement Compass Calibration Feature
description:
Title: Qibla Finder Compass Calibration

Description:
As a user, I want to calibrate my compass to prevent inaccurate readings, so that the Qibla Finder always provides precise directionality.

Point Value: 5

Acceptance Criteria:
- A calibration prompt appears when the user opens the Qibla Finder.
- Instructions for calibrating the deviceâ€™s compass are displayed clearly.
- After calibration, the compass accuracy is improved, and the user is notified.

Definition of Done (DoD):
- The calibration process is easy to follow and does not require unnecessary steps.
- The feature is tested to ensure improved compass accuracy after calibration.
- The calibration prompt does not appear redundantly after the user has already calibrated.
- Code is committed and pushed to the repository.

Non-Functional Requirements:
- User Experience: Instructions should be clear and concise to avoid user confusion.
- Performance: Calibration should take less than 10 seconds to complete.

notes.note: marked this issue as related to #3
